title: Is any mini GPU a low profile GPU? - Quora

response.answer_text: Low profiles have certain height measurements to fit in those narrow, flat small form factor cases. They’re often not as fast, but they have to be small to fit in those tiny cases. A “Mini” GPU can vary, cuz there’s a brand out there that actually uses it as a part of the brand. Might be EVGA or GIGABYTE, but i’ve seen some GPU’s labled mini which fit into SFF cases, and some which were actually just shorter but full height and designed to fit in short stout cases like mini ATX cases. So I think the order goes: low profile is for small form factor or SFF PC’s, Mini is for MINI ATX cases, M.2 is for laptops, and everything else is for fullsized ATX cases and such.

This is a mini graphics card:  it is not narrow and it is not thin. But it is short. (Amd’s R9 nano)  This is a low profile graphics card:  it is not short and it is not thin. But it is narrow. (Msi Gtx 1050 Low profile )  This is a single-slot card:  it is not short and it is not narrow. But it is thin. (Inno3d Gtx1050 one-slot edition)
